courses: Data Structures & Algorithms I & II, Software QA, Systems Software, Operating Systems, Functional Programming, Cloud Computing, Cryptography & Network Security, Data Science

education.institution: Julia R. Masterman Laboratory and Demonstration School

work.name: WebstaurantStore
work.summary: Automated quality assurance tasks for web applications.
highlights: Wrote automation scripts to test storefront and admin pages using Groovy and Selenium.
Wrote SQL queries to fetch appropriate test data from database tables.
Wrote unit tests for shared classes used in automation scripts.
Monitored nightly runs of automated tests, communicating with developers when bugs arose.

work.name: Innovative Systems
work.summary: Developed software tools and APIs for data transformation and validation.
highlights: Built a multi-threaded ETL tool for transformation & validation of records, supporting multiple file formats.
Developed an API to extract core functionality into a shared library, complete with unit & integration tests.
Built a plugin system for custom processing operations to be dynamically loaded & executed.
Thoroughly documented work for continued development of the software.

work.name: University of Pittsburgh, School of Computing and Information
work.summary: Assisted students in programming courses by leading recitations and office hours.
highlights: Lead recitations for 30+ students for CS 11 - Intro to Programming (Python), CS 401 - Intermediate Programming (Java), and CS 449 - Intro to Systems Software (C).
Coordinated lecture reviews, held office hours, and helped students work through assignments.

work.name: Dynamics Inc.
work.summary: Developed and tested a database application for internal use.
highlights: Planned, developed, and tested the frontend & backend for an internal database application.
Implemented CRUD operations on the database & server-side sorting, filtering, and pagination.
Worked with .NET & WPF frameworks, programming in C# and SQL.
Submitted pull requests, received code reviews, and demoed work regularly.

projects.name: Cinect
projects.summary: A movie recommendation platform using a KNN clustering algorithm.
highlights: Delivers movie recommendations using a KNN clustering algorithm.
Driven using data from a group of users on Letterboxd, a film review site.
Utilized GitHub Actions to automatically deploy to GCP services.
Built with ReactJS, Flask, Firebase, and Cloud Run.

projects.name: Lost @ Pitt
projects.summary: A multi-platform app for tracking lost items on campus.
highlights: Second place at SteelHacks 2023.
Finalist at the Pitt Big Idea Competition 2024.
Built using Flutter, Dart, and Firebase.

projects.name: Astralnaut
projects.summary: A 2D survival game built using OOP concepts.
highlights: Programmed in GDScript and built scenes & animations with Godot tools.
